title: 'Collapsed in shower': This Australian family claims their fridge is making them sick
content: ​An Australian family has claimed their fridge is making them so sick that they have never experienced such symptoms in their life. According to an Australian news outlet 9news, Adele and Alex Rae -- the couple -- experienced irritation to the nose, eyes and throat because of a strange smell that they said was coming from their Samsung fridge on May 19.
summary: ​An Australian family has claimed their fridge is making them so sick that they have never experienced such symptoms in their life. According to an Australian news outlet 9news, Adele and Alex Rae -- the couple -- experienced irritation to the nose, eyes and throat because of a strange smell that they said was coming from their Samsung fridge on May 19.

title: 'If I'm elected...': Donald Trump's massive 'will send them to jail' warning
content: ​​Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said Wednesday if he is elected president, he will send all 'Election fraudsters' to jail for long period of time. "We already know who you are. DON'T DO IT! ZUCKERBUCKS, be careful!" Trump posted on Truth Social. Calling Joe Biden 'incapacitated moron', Trump said Republicans must pass the Save Act or go home.
summary: ​​Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said Wednesday if he is elected president, he will send all 'Election fraudsters' to jail for long period of time. "We already know who you are. DON'T DO IT! ZUCKERBUCKS, be careful!" Trump posted on Truth Social. Calling Joe Biden 'incapacitated moron', Trump said Republicans must pass the Save Act or go home.

title: Russia denies involvement in missile strikes at children's hospital in Kyiv
content: Russia has dismissed allegations of its involvement in the missile strikes that damaged a children's hospital in Kyiv on Monday, attributing the damage to Ukraine's anti-missile defense systems instead. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov clarified Russia's position on Tuesday, stating that the destruction was due to Ukraine's defensive actions. "Russia's stance has never been to target civilian infrastructure in Ukraine," Peskov asserted, though he provided no evidence to support this claim. Peskov urged reporters to rely only on statements by official Russian authority.
summary: Russia has dismissed allegations of its involvement in the missile strikes that damaged a children's hospital in Kyiv on Monday, attributing the damage to Ukraine's anti-missile defense systems instead. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov clarified Russia's position on Tuesday, stating that the destruction was due to Ukraine's defensive actions. "Russia's stance has never been to target civilian infrastructure in Ukraine," Peskov asserted, though he provided no evidence to support this claim. Peskov urged reporters to rely only on statements by official Russian authority.

title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif urges international community to recognise 'burden of Afghan refugees' in meeting with UNHCR chief
Flooding in northern Bangladesh displaces 40,000 people, shuts schools
content: Devastating floods in Bangladesh displace tens of thousands, with homes swept away and schools shut. More heavy rain expected to worsen the situation. Over 40,000 seek refuge in shelters as medical teams rush to treat flood victims. Villagers wade through knee-deep water, rescuing cattle and sheltering on makeshift rafts. Death toll rises in India with millions affected. Rare rhinoceros habitat inundated. Chaos in Delhi and Mumbai as heavy rains disrupt daily life.
summary: Devastating floods in Bangladesh displace tens of thousands, with homes swept away and schools shut. More heavy rain expected to worsen the situation. Over 40,000 seek refuge in shelters as medical teams rush to treat flood victims. Villagers wade through knee-deep water, rescuing cattle and sheltering on makeshift rafts. Death toll rises in India with millions affected. Rare rhinoceros habitat inundated. Chaos in Delhi and Mumbai as heavy rains disrupt daily life.

title: Drug 100 times deadlier than heroin causes severe health risks in Australia
content: Harm Reduction Victoria has issued an urgent health alert after synthetic opioid proto-nitazene was found in cocaine, causing severe effects like loss of consciousness and respiratory depression. This follows a series of opioid overdoses in Australia, mirroring trends in North America. Authorities stress vigilance and the need for harm reduction services to prevent a potential crisis.
summary: Harm Reduction Victoria has issued an urgent health alert after synthetic opioid proto-nitazene was found in cocaine, causing severe effects like loss of consciousness and respiratory depression. This follows a series of opioid overdoses in Australia, mirroring trends in North America. Authorities stress vigilance and the need for harm reduction services to prevent a potential crisis.

title: Do's and don'ts on Spain beach: Peeing on sand can land you in big trouble
content: The Marbella city council introduced measures in May aimed at improving beach quality, including fines of up to €750 for individuals caught relieving themselves on the beach, excluding the sea. Repeat offenders may face penalties of up to €1500 within a year. The regulations also target other disruptive behaviours like loud music and littering, aiming to maintain a pleasant environment across Marbella's 25 beaches amid peak tourist seasons.
summary: The Marbella city council introduced measures in May aimed at improving beach quality, including fines of up to €750 for individuals caught relieving themselves on the beach, excluding the sea. Repeat offenders may face penalties of up to €1500 within a year. The regulations also target other disruptive behaviours like loud music and littering, aiming to maintain a pleasant environment across Marbella's 25 beaches amid peak tourist seasons.

title: 'Flight from hell': British Airways plane diverts after mid-flight lightning strike
content: A British Airways flight from Stuttgart to Heathrow was struck by lightning, forcing it to divert to Gatwick Airport. Despite the scare, passengers praised the crew for their handling of the situation. Another British Airways flight from Lisbon to London was also struck by lightning but landed safely. Both incidents were attributed to severe weather.
summary: A British Airways flight from Stuttgart to Heathrow was struck by lightning, forcing it to divert to Gatwick Airport. Despite the scare, passengers praised the crew for their handling of the situation. Another British Airways flight from Lisbon to London was also struck by lightning but landed safely. Both incidents were attributed to severe weather.

title: Satellite imagery shows Iran expanding its ballistic missile facilities
content: Recent satellite imagery confirms Iran's expansion of ballistic missile facilities near Tehran, aimed at increasing production. The move, supported by Iranian officials, includes supplying missiles to Russia for the Ukraine conflict. The US and Israel express concerns over the potential impact of increased drone and missile production.
summary: Recent satellite imagery confirms Iran's expansion of ballistic missile facilities near Tehran, aimed at increasing production. The move, supported by Iranian officials, includes supplying missiles to Russia for the Ukraine conflict. The US and Israel express concerns over the potential impact of increased drone and missile production.

title: 'Stunned' Prince Harry reacts to criticism over his nomination for ESPY's Pat Tillman Award
content: Prince Harry faced backlash upon being named the 2024 ESPY Pat Tillman Award for Service recipient, with critics, including Tillman's mother, questioning the choice. ESPN defended the decision citing Harry's Invictus Games contributions, yet a petition against it gathered 68,000 signatures. Critics argued others in the veteran community were more deserving, lacking Harry's privileges. Former NFL player Pat McAfee suggested a separate category for him, highlighting the controversy surrounding the announcement.
summary: Prince Harry faced backlash upon being named the 2024 ESPY Pat Tillman Award for Service recipient, with critics, including Tillman's mother, questioning the choice. ESPN defended the decision citing Harry's Invictus Games contributions, yet a petition against it gathered 68,000 signatures. Critics argued others in the veteran community were more deserving, lacking Harry's privileges. Former NFL player Pat McAfee suggested a separate category for him, highlighting the controversy surrounding the announcement.

title: United Airlines Boeing aircraft loses wheel after takeoff from Los Angeles
content: This marks the second instance in recent months where a United Airlines-operated Boeing aircraft lost a wheel following takeoff. In March, a Boeing 777 en route to Japan experienced a tire fall shortly after leaving San Francisco, necessitating an emergency landing.
summary: This marks the second instance in recent months where a United Airlines-operated Boeing aircraft lost a wheel following takeoff. In March, a Boeing 777 en route to Japan experienced a tire fall shortly after leaving San Francisco, necessitating an emergency landing.

title: Who is Kash Patel? Security advisor of Donald Trump who may get position in FBI or CIA
content: Kash Patel, expected to be influential in a Trump second term, is tied to Trump Media (Truth Social) and paid advisory fees. He discussed media targeting with Steve Bannon, was considered for FBI/CIA roles, co-authored the Nunes Memo, held National Security Council positions, supported whistleblowers via his foundation, and launched Fight with Kash organization for educational initiatives.
summary: Kash Patel, expected to be influential in a Trump second term, is tied to Trump Media (Truth Social) and paid advisory fees. He discussed media targeting with Steve Bannon, was considered for FBI/CIA roles, co-authored the Nunes Memo, held National Security Council positions, supported whistleblowers via his foundation, and launched Fight with Kash organization for educational initiatives.

title: White House clarifies on Parkinson's expert's visit to Biden: 'No'
content: ​Amid reports that a Parkinson's disease expert visited the White House and met President Joe Biden's doctor in January, the White House Monday said the president is not being treated for Parkinson's disease. The press briefing turned chaotic as press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre was asked to give clear answer on the visit of the Parkinson's specialist to which she strongly reacted and said she won't be able to divulge any name of experts for privacy and security reasons. She said Biden had seen a neurologist three times -- in three years -- connected to Biden's annual physical exams.
summary: ​Amid reports that a Parkinson's disease expert visited the White House and met President Joe Biden's doctor in January, the White House Monday said the president is not being treated for Parkinson's disease. The press briefing turned chaotic as press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre was asked to give clear answer on the visit of the Parkinson's specialist to which she strongly reacted and said she won't be able to divulge any name of experts for privacy and security reasons. She said Biden had seen a neurologist three times -- in three years -- connected to Biden's annual physical exams.

title: 'Justifying terrorism': Russian playwright and director held for playing Islamic State wives play
content: Playwright Svetlana Petriychuk and director Yevgenia Berkovich were sentenced to six years in prison for 'justifying terrorism' in their play 'Finist the Brave Falcon.' The trial raised concerns about freedom of expression in Russia. International condemnation follows amid a crackdown on anti-war sentiment in the artistic community.
summary: Playwright Svetlana Petriychuk and director Yevgenia Berkovich were sentenced to six years in prison for 'justifying terrorism' in their play 'Finist the Brave Falcon.' The trial raised concerns about freedom of expression in Russia. International condemnation follows amid a crackdown on anti-war sentiment in the artistic community.

title: This balcony is listed for rent at $360 per week in Sydney: 'Sunny room'
content: The photo of a balcony of a Sydney apartment has gone viral because it has been listed for rent in an advertisement on Facebook marketplace. The post qualifies the balcony as a "sunny room" in Haymarket but social media users commented that the sunny room is actually a broad balcony and nothing else.
summary: The photo of a balcony of a Sydney apartment has gone viral because it has been listed for rent in an advertisement on Facebook marketplace. The post qualifies the balcony as a "sunny room" in Haymarket but social media users commented that the sunny room is actually a broad balcony and nothing else.

title: Secret memo to replace Biden by August in circulation: 'Lord Almighty...'
content: ​President Joe Biden recently said he will opt out of the presidential race only if Lord Almighty asks him to do so. With a clear reference to that, a secret but detailed memo is being circulated among the Democrats saying, "Lord helps those who help themselves". The memo is to replace President Biden in a "blitz primary" before the party's convention in August if Biden can not be convinced to bow out. Two influential Democratic operatives are circulating the memo, New York Post reported citing Semafor.
summary: ​President Joe Biden recently said he will opt out of the presidential race only if Lord Almighty asks him to do so. With a clear reference to that, a secret but detailed memo is being circulated among the Democrats saying, "Lord helps those who help themselves". The memo is to replace President Biden in a "blitz primary" before the party's convention in August if Biden can not be convinced to bow out. Two influential Democratic operatives are circulating the memo, New York Post reported citing Semafor.

title: 2 men drown in Glacier National Park over the July 4 holiday weekend
content: Two men from India and Nepal drowned in Glacier National Park during the July 4 weekend. One slipped on Avalanche Lake Trail and was swept through a gorge; the other drowned in Lake McDonald, recovered at 35-40 feet depth by 8:20 pm. Consulates contacted. Both were vacationing from Portland, Oregon.
summary: Two men from India and Nepal drowned in Glacier National Park during the July 4 weekend. One slipped on Avalanche Lake Trail and was swept through a gorge; the other drowned in Lake McDonald, recovered at 35-40 feet depth by 8:20 pm. Consulates contacted. Both were vacationing from Portland, Oregon.

title: Defiant Biden tells party he will not quit as support continues to wane
'Run against me': Biden makes 3 things clear amid age row
content: ​President Joe Biden started the week with a bang -- first shooting off a letter to Democrats in doubt over his candidacy and then appearing on NBC's Morning Joe where he vigorously stamped out the growing criticism inside the party about his age, health etc. In a contrast to a shaky Biden, the president appeared firm and resolute as he said he does not care about what the elite donors are saying; he knows he can defeat Donald Trump and that's why he is in the race.
summary: ​President Joe Biden started the week with a bang -- first shooting off a letter to Democrats in doubt over his candidacy and then appearing on NBC's Morning Joe where he vigorously stamped out the growing criticism inside the party about his age, health etc. In a contrast to a shaky Biden, the president appeared firm and resolute as he said he does not care about what the elite donors are saying; he knows he can defeat Donald Trump and that's why he is in the race.

title: Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico takes first trip outside capital after assassination attempt
